title: Festus Perera
text:
Michael Festus Wenceslaus Perera (1931 - 2013) was a Sri Lankan politician. He was first elected to parliament representing <a href="Wennappuwa%20Electoral%20District">Wennappuwa</a> at the <a href="1965%20Ceylonese%20parliamentary%20election">6th parliamentary election</a> in 1965. He failed to get re-elected at the subsequent <a href="1970%20Ceylonese%20parliamentary%20election">1970 parliamentary election</a> but was successful at the <a href="1977%20Sri%20Lankan%20parliamentary%20election">8th parliamentary election</a> in 1977. At the <a href="1989%20Sri%20Lankan%20parliamentary%20election">9th parliamentary election</a> the Wennappuwa electorate was replaced by the <a href="Puttalam%20Electoral%20District">Puttalam multi-member electoral district</a>. Perera was elected as one of the constituency's members from 1989 to 2001.
Personal life.
Perera was married to former member of parliament <a href="Larine%20Perera">Larine Perera</a> and is the father of former member of parliament <a href="Niroshan%20Perera">Niroshan Perera</a>. Perera died on 12 January 2013 at the age of 81.
